item.title: [PI] Overloads
item.dc:creator: @DerpaDerpy DerpaDerpy
item.description:
@DerpaDerpy wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:9, topic:509123”][quote author=DerpaDerpy link=topic=627367.msg4263287#msg4263287 date=1363659729]

Ok, I replaced:

for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) { if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null) if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 65535 //Most triangles || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0 //Black Triangles 633 Models || anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 //Nezzy Green Triangles//GWD White Triangles )
With:

[code]for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) {
if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null)
if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0) {

                            }[/code]

And this happened:

I’m not even sure how to explain it… Everything just lost color maybe?

Hmm… Try replacing your method479 with mine (save a backup first):

	public final void method479(int i, int j, int k, int l, int i1, boolean flag) {
		int j1 = (int) Math.sqrt(k * k + l * l + i1 * i1);
		int k1 = j * j1 >> 8;
		if (anIntArray1634 == null) {
			anIntArray1634 = new int[anInt1630];
			anIntArray1635 = new int[anInt1630];
			anIntArray1636 = new int[anInt1630];
		}
		if (super.aClass33Array1425 == null) {
			super.aClass33Array1425 = new Class33[anInt1626];
			for (int l1 = 0; l1 < anInt1626; l1++)
				super.aClass33Array1425[l1] = new Class33();

		}
		for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) {
			if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null)
				/*
				if (//anIntArray1640[i2] == 65535 ||
				anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 ||
				anIntArray1640[i2] == 0
				) {
					//anIntArray1639[i2] = 255;
				}
				*/
				if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0) {
					//do nothing lol
				}
			
			int j2 = anIntArray1631[i2];
			int l2 = anIntArray1632[i2];
			int i3 = anIntArray1633[i2];
			int j3 = anIntArray1627[l2] - anIntArray1627[j2];
			int k3 = anIntArray1628[l2] - anIntArray1628[j2];
			int l3 = anIntArray1629[l2] - anIntArray1629[j2];
			int i4 = anIntArray1627[i3] - anIntArray1627[j2];
			int j4 = anIntArray1628[i3] - anIntArray1628[j2];
			int k4 = anIntArray1629[i3] - anIntArray1629[j2];
			int l4 = k3 * k4 - j4 * l3;
			int i5 = l3 * i4 - k4 * j3;
			int j5;
			for (j5 = j3 * j4 - i4 * k3; l4 > 8192 || i5 > 8192 || j5 > 8192
			|| l4 < -8192 || i5 < -8192 || j5 < -8192; j5 >>= 1) {
				l4 >>= 1;
			i5 >>= 1;
			}

			int k5 = (int) Math.sqrt(l4 * l4 + i5 * i5 + j5 * j5);
			if (k5 <= 0)
				k5 = 1;
			l4 = (l4 * 256) / k5;
			i5 = (i5 * 256) / k5;
			j5 = (j5 * 256) / k5;

			if (anIntArray1637 == null || (anIntArray1637[i2] & 1) == 0) {

				Class33 class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[j2];
				class33_2.anInt602 += l4;
				class33_2.anInt603 += i5;
				class33_2.anInt604 += j5;
				class33_2.anInt605++;
				class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[l2];
				class33_2.anInt602 += l4;
				class33_2.anInt603 += i5;
				class33_2.anInt604 += j5;
				class33_2.anInt605++;
				class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[i3];
				class33_2.anInt602 += l4;
				class33_2.anInt603 += i5;
				class33_2.anInt604 += j5;
				class33_2.anInt605++;

			} else {

				int l5 = i + (k * l4 + l * i5 + i1 * j5) / (k1 + k1 / 2);
				anIntArray1634[i2] = method481(anIntArray1640[i2], l5,
						anIntArray1637[i2]);

			}
		}

		if (flag) {
			method480(i, k1, k, l, i1);
		} else {
			aClass33Array1660 = new Class33[anInt1626];
			for (int k2 = 0; k2 < anInt1626; k2++) {
				Class33 class33 = super.aClass33Array1425[k2];
				Class33 class33_1 = aClass33Array1660[k2] = new Class33();
				class33_1.anInt602 = class33.anInt602;
				class33_1.anInt603 = class33.anInt603;
				class33_1.anInt604 = class33.anInt604;
				class33_1.anInt605 = class33.anInt605;
			}

		}
		if (flag) {
			method466();
			return;
		} else {
			method468(21073);
			return;
		}
	}

[/quote][quote author=Fridder link=topic=627367.msg4263283#msg4263283 date=1363659058]

Ok, I replaced:

for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) { if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null) if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 65535 //Most triangles || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0 //Black Triangles 633 Models || anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 //Nezzy Green Triangles//GWD White Triangles )
With:

[code]for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) {
if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null)
if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0) {

                            }[/code]

And this happened:

I’m not even sure how to explain it… Everything just lost color maybe?

Hmm… Try replacing your method479 with mine (save a backup first):

	public final void method479(int i, int j, int k, int l, int i1, boolean flag) {
		int j1 = (int) Math.sqrt(k * k + l * l + i1 * i1);
		int k1 = j * j1 >> 8;
		if (anIntArray1634 == null) {
			anIntArray1634 = new int[anInt1630];
			anIntArray1635 = new int[anInt1630];
			anIntArray1636 = new int[anInt1630];
		}
		if (super.aClass33Array1425 == null) {
			super.aClass33Array1425 = new Class33[anInt1626];
			for (int l1 = 0; l1 < anInt1626; l1++)
				super.aClass33Array1425[l1] = new Class33();

		}
		for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) {
			if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null)
				/*
				if (//anIntArray1640[i2] == 65535 ||
				anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 ||
				anIntArray1640[i2] == 0
				) {
					//anIntArray1639[i2] = 255;
				}
				*/
				if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0) {
					//do nothing lol
				}
			
			int j2 = anIntArray1631[i2];
			int l2 = anIntArray1632[i2];
			int i3 = anIntArray1633[i2];
			int j3 = anIntArray1627[l2] - anIntArray1627[j2];
			int k3 = anIntArray1628[l2] - anIntArray1628[j2];
			int l3 = anIntArray1629[l2] - anIntArray1629[j2];
			int i4 = anIntArray1627[i3] - anIntArray1627[j2];
			int j4 = anIntArray1628[i3] - anIntArray1628[j2];
			int k4 = anIntArray1629[i3] - anIntArray1629[j2];
			int l4 = k3 * k4 - j4 * l3;
			int i5 = l3 * i4 - k4 * j3;
			int j5;
			for (j5 = j3 * j4 - i4 * k3; l4 > 8192 || i5 > 8192 || j5 > 8192
			|| l4 < -8192 || i5 < -8192 || j5 < -8192; j5 >>= 1) {
				l4 >>= 1;
			i5 >>= 1;
			}

			int k5 = (int) Math.sqrt(l4 * l4 + i5 * i5 + j5 * j5);
			if (k5 <= 0)
				k5 = 1;
			l4 = (l4 * 256) / k5;
			i5 = (i5 * 256) / k5;
			j5 = (j5 * 256) / k5;

			if (anIntArray1637 == null || (anIntArray1637[i2] & 1) == 0) {

				Class33 class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[j2];
				class33_2.anInt602 += l4;
				class33_2.anInt603 += i5;
				class33_2.anInt604 += j5;
				class33_2.anInt605++;
				class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[l2];
				class33_2.anInt602 += l4;
				class33_2.anInt603 += i5;
				class33_2.anInt604 += j5;
				class33_2.anInt605++;
				class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[i3];
				class33_2.anInt602 += l4;
				class33_2.anInt603 += i5;
				class33_2.anInt604 += j5;
				class33_2.anInt605++;

			} else {

				int l5 = i + (k * l4 + l * i5 + i1 * j5) / (k1 + k1 / 2);
				anIntArray1634[i2] = method481(anIntArray1640[i2], l5,
						anIntArray1637[i2]);

			}
		}

		if (flag) {
			method480(i, k1, k, l, i1);
		} else {
			aClass33Array1660 = new Class33[anInt1626];
			for (int k2 = 0; k2 < anInt1626; k2++) {
				Class33 class33 = super.aClass33Array1425[k2];
				Class33 class33_1 = aClass33Array1660[k2] = new Class33();
				class33_1.anInt602 = class33.anInt602;
				class33_1.anInt603 = class33.anInt603;
				class33_1.anInt604 = class33.anInt604;
				class33_1.anInt605 = class33.anInt605;
			}

		}
		if (flag) {
			method466();
			return;
		} else {
			method468(21073);
			return;
		}
	}

[/quote]Ok, I replaced it and it worked, but it affected some stuff.
For Example, some NPCs and object are mostly black:

The black on that NPC is supposed to be there, but the triangle is not.
I sent you a PM, did that work?[/quote]Never got a PM and I also figured out that,

anIntArray1639[i2] = 255;

this code right here used with:

if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0) { //do nothing lol }
makes the game look like the one picture above:

2vkyzd1.png769×387

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Overloads
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“DerpaDerpy, post:7, topic:509123”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=627367.msg4263283#msg4263283 date=1363659058]

Ok, I replaced:

for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) { if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null) if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 65535 //Most triangles || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0 //Black Triangles 633 Models || anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 //Nezzy Green Triangles//GWD White Triangles )
With:

[code]for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) {
if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null)
if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0) {

                            }[/code]

And this happened:

I’m not even sure how to explain it… Everything just lost color maybe?

Hmm… Try replacing your method479 with mine (save a backup first):

	public final void method479(int i, int j, int k, int l, int i1, boolean flag) {
		int j1 = (int) Math.sqrt(k * k + l * l + i1 * i1);
		int k1 = j * j1 >> 8;
		if (anIntArray1634 == null) {
			anIntArray1634 = new int[anInt1630];
			anIntArray1635 = new int[anInt1630];
			anIntArray1636 = new int[anInt1630];
		}
		if (super.aClass33Array1425 == null) {
			super.aClass33Array1425 = new Class33[anInt1626];
			for (int l1 = 0; l1 < anInt1626; l1++)
				super.aClass33Array1425[l1] = new Class33();

		}
		for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) {
			if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null)
				/*
				if (//anIntArray1640[i2] == 65535 ||
				anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 ||
				anIntArray1640[i2] == 0
				) {
					//anIntArray1639[i2] = 255;
				}
				*/
				if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0) {
					//do nothing lol
				}
			
			int j2 = anIntArray1631[i2];
			int l2 = anIntArray1632[i2];
			int i3 = anIntArray1633[i2];
			int j3 = anIntArray1627[l2] - anIntArray1627[j2];
			int k3 = anIntArray1628[l2] - anIntArray1628[j2];
			int l3 = anIntArray1629[l2] - anIntArray1629[j2];
			int i4 = anIntArray1627[i3] - anIntArray1627[j2];
			int j4 = anIntArray1628[i3] - anIntArray1628[j2];
			int k4 = anIntArray1629[i3] - anIntArray1629[j2];
			int l4 = k3 * k4 - j4 * l3;
			int i5 = l3 * i4 - k4 * j3;
			int j5;
			for (j5 = j3 * j4 - i4 * k3; l4 > 8192 || i5 > 8192 || j5 > 8192
			|| l4 < -8192 || i5 < -8192 || j5 < -8192; j5 >>= 1) {
				l4 >>= 1;
			i5 >>= 1;
			}

			int k5 = (int) Math.sqrt(l4 * l4 + i5 * i5 + j5 * j5);
			if (k5 <= 0)
				k5 = 1;
			l4 = (l4 * 256) / k5;
			i5 = (i5 * 256) / k5;
			j5 = (j5 * 256) / k5;

			if (anIntArray1637 == null || (anIntArray1637[i2] & 1) == 0) {

				Class33 class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[j2];
				class33_2.anInt602 += l4;
				class33_2.anInt603 += i5;
				class33_2.anInt604 += j5;
				class33_2.anInt605++;
				class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[l2];
				class33_2.anInt602 += l4;
				class33_2.anInt603 += i5;
				class33_2.anInt604 += j5;
				class33_2.anInt605++;
				class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[i3];
				class33_2.anInt602 += l4;
				class33_2.anInt603 += i5;
				class33_2.anInt604 += j5;
				class33_2.anInt605++;

			} else {

				int l5 = i + (k * l4 + l * i5 + i1 * j5) / (k1 + k1 / 2);
				anIntArray1634[i2] = method481(anIntArray1640[i2], l5,
						anIntArray1637[i2]);

			}
		}

		if (flag) {
			method480(i, k1, k, l, i1);
		} else {
			aClass33Array1660 = new Class33[anInt1626];
			for (int k2 = 0; k2 < anInt1626; k2++) {
				Class33 class33 = super.aClass33Array1425[k2];
				Class33 class33_1 = aClass33Array1660[k2] = new Class33();
				class33_1.anInt602 = class33.anInt602;
				class33_1.anInt603 = class33.anInt603;
				class33_1.anInt604 = class33.anInt604;
				class33_1.anInt605 = class33.anInt605;
			}

		}
		if (flag) {
			method466();
			return;
		} else {
			method468(21073);
			return;
		}
	}

[/quote][quote author=Fridder link=topic=627367.msg4263283#msg4263283 date=1363659058]

Ok, I replaced:

for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) { if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null) if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 65535 //Most triangles || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0 //Black Triangles 633 Models || anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 //Nezzy Green Triangles//GWD White Triangles )
With:

[code]for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) {
if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null)
if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0) {

                            }[/code]

And this happened:

I’m not even sure how to explain it… Everything just lost color maybe?

Hmm… Try replacing your method479 with mine (save a backup first):

	public final void method479(int i, int j, int k, int l, int i1, boolean flag) {
		int j1 = (int) Math.sqrt(k * k + l * l + i1 * i1);
		int k1 = j * j1 >> 8;
		if (anIntArray1634 == null) {
			anIntArray1634 = new int[anInt1630];
			anIntArray1635 = new int[anInt1630];
			anIntArray1636 = new int[anInt1630];
		}
		if (super.aClass33Array1425 == null) {
			super.aClass33Array1425 = new Class33[anInt1626];
			for (int l1 = 0; l1 < anInt1626; l1++)
				super.aClass33Array1425[l1] = new Class33();

		}
		for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) {
			if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null)
				/*
				if (//anIntArray1640[i2] == 65535 ||
				anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 ||
				anIntArray1640[i2] == 0
				) {
					//anIntArray1639[i2] = 255;
				}
				*/
				if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0) {
					//do nothing lol
				}
			
			int j2 = anIntArray1631[i2];
			int l2 = anIntArray1632[i2];
			int i3 = anIntArray1633[i2];
			int j3 = anIntArray1627[l2] - anIntArray1627[j2];
			int k3 = anIntArray1628[l2] - anIntArray1628[j2];
			int l3 = anIntArray1629[l2] - anIntArray1629[j2];
			int i4 = anIntArray1627[i3] - anIntArray1627[j2];
			int j4 = anIntArray1628[i3] - anIntArray1628[j2];
			int k4 = anIntArray1629[i3] - anIntArray1629[j2];
			int l4 = k3 * k4 - j4 * l3;
			int i5 = l3 * i4 - k4 * j3;
			int j5;
			for (j5 = j3 * j4 - i4 * k3; l4 > 8192 || i5 > 8192 || j5 > 8192
			|| l4 < -8192 || i5 < -8192 || j5 < -8192; j5 >>= 1) {
				l4 >>= 1;
			i5 >>= 1;
			}

			int k5 = (int) Math.sqrt(l4 * l4 + i5 * i5 + j5 * j5);
			if (k5 <= 0)
				k5 = 1;
			l4 = (l4 * 256) / k5;
			i5 = (i5 * 256) / k5;
			j5 = (j5 * 256) / k5;

			if (anIntArray1637 == null || (anIntArray1637[i2] & 1) == 0) {

				Class33 class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[j2];
				class33_2.anInt602 += l4;
				class33_2.anInt603 += i5;
				class33_2.anInt604 += j5;
				class33_2.anInt605++;
				class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[l2];
				class33_2.anInt602 += l4;
				class33_2.anInt603 += i5;
				class33_2.anInt604 += j5;
				class33_2.anInt605++;
				class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[i3];
				class33_2.anInt602 += l4;
				class33_2.anInt603 += i5;
				class33_2.anInt604 += j5;
				class33_2.anInt605++;

			} else {

				int l5 = i + (k * l4 + l * i5 + i1 * j5) / (k1 + k1 / 2);
				anIntArray1634[i2] = method481(anIntArray1640[i2], l5,
						anIntArray1637[i2]);

			}
		}

		if (flag) {
			method480(i, k1, k, l, i1);
		} else {
			aClass33Array1660 = new Class33[anInt1626];
			for (int k2 = 0; k2 < anInt1626; k2++) {
				Class33 class33 = super.aClass33Array1425[k2];
				Class33 class33_1 = aClass33Array1660[k2] = new Class33();
				class33_1.anInt602 = class33.anInt602;
				class33_1.anInt603 = class33.anInt603;
				class33_1.anInt604 = class33.anInt604;
				class33_1.anInt605 = class33.anInt605;
			}

		}
		if (flag) {
			method466();
			return;
		} else {
			method468(21073);
			return;
		}
	}

[/quote]Ok, I replaced it and it worked, but it affected some stuff.
For Example, some NPCs and object are mostly black:

34s110h.png1367×347
[/quote]

The black on that NPC is supposed to be there, but the triangle is not.
I sent you a PM, did that work?

item.title: [PI] Overloads
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:

The most common solution people use if they want the overloads to be ‘nearly’ the same, is use the models for Fishing potions.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Overloads
item.dc:creator: @DerpaDerpy DerpaDerpy
item.description:
@DerpaDerpy wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:6, topic:509123”][quote author=DerpaDerpy link=topic=627367.msg4263279#msg4263279 date=1363658795]
Ok, I replaced:

for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) { if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null) if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 65535 //Most triangles || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0 //Black Triangles 633 Models || anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 //Nezzy Green Triangles//GWD White Triangles )
With:

[code]for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) {
if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null)
if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0) {

                            }[/code]

And this happened:

I’m not even sure how to explain it… Everything just lost color maybe?
[/quote]

Hmm… Try replacing your method479 with mine (save a backup first):

[code=java]
public final void method479(int i, int j, int k, int l, int i1, boolean flag) {
int j1 = (int) Math.sqrt(k * k + l * l + i1 * i1);
int k1 = j * j1 >> 8;
if (anIntArray1634 == null) {
anIntArray1634 = new int[anInt1630];
anIntArray1635 = new int[anInt1630];
anIntArray1636 = new int[anInt1630];
}
if (super.aClass33Array1425 == null) {
super.aClass33Array1425 = new Class33[anInt1626];
for (int l1 = 0; l1 < anInt1626; l1++)
super.aClass33Array1425[l1] = new Class33();

		int i3 = anIntArray1633[i2];
		int j3 = anIntArray1627[l2] - anIntArray1627[j2];

		|| l4 < -8192 || i5 < -8192 || j5 < -8192; j5 >>= 1) {
			l4 >>= 1;
		i5 >>= 1;
		}

		int k5 = (int) Math.sqrt(l4 * l4 + i5 * i5 + j5 * j5);
		if (k5 <= 0)
			k5 = 1;
		l4 = (l4 * 256) / k5;
		i5 = (i5 * 256) / k5;
		j5 = (j5 * 256) / k5;

			class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[l2];

			class33_2.anInt604 += j5;

}

		|| l4 < -8192 || i5 < -8192 || j5 < -8192; j5 >>= 1) {

Hmm… Try replacing your method479 with mine (save a backup first):

	public final void method479(int i, int j, int k, int l, int i1, boolean flag) {
		int j1 = (int) Math.sqrt(k * k + l * l + i1 * i1);
		int k1 = j * j1 >> 8;
		if (anIntArray1634 == null) {
			anIntArray1634 = new int[anInt1630];
			anIntArray1635 = new int[anInt1630];

		}
		if (super.aClass33Array1425 == null) {
			super.aClass33Array1425 = new Class33[anInt1626];
			for (int l1 = 0; l1 < anInt1626; l1++)
				super.aClass33Array1425[l1] = new Class33();

		}
		for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) {
			if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null)
				/*
				if (//anIntArray1640[i2] == 65535 ||
				anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 ||
				anIntArray1640[i2] == 0
				) {
					//anIntArray1639[i2] = 255;
				}
				*/
				if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0) {
					//do nothing lol
				}
			
			int j2 = anIntArray1631[i2];
			int l2 = anIntArray1632[i2];
			int i3 = anIntArray1633[i2];
			int j3 = anIntArray1627[l2] - anIntArray1627[j2];
			int k3 = anIntArray1628[l2] - anIntArray1628[j2];
			int l3 = anIntArray1629[l2] - anIntArray1629[j2];
			int i4 = anIntArray1627[i3] - anIntArray1627[j2];
			int j4 = anIntArray1628[i3] - anIntArray1628[j2];
			int k4 = anIntArray1629[i3] - anIntArray1629[j2];
			int l4 = k3 * k4 - j4 * l3;
			int i5 = l3 * i4 - k4 * j3;
			int j5;
			for (j5 = j3 * j4 - i4 * k3; l4 > 8192 || i5 > 8192 || j5 > 8192
			|| l4 < -8192 || i5 < -8192 || j5 < -8192; j5 >>= 1) {
				l4 >>= 1;
			i5 >>= 1;
			}

			int k5 = (int) Math.sqrt(l4 * l4 + i5 * i5 + j5 * j5);
			if (k5 <= 0)
				k5 = 1;
			l4 = (l4 * 256) / k5;
			i5 = (i5 * 256) / k5;
			j5 = (j5 * 256) / k5;

			if (anIntArray1637 == null || (anIntArray1637[i2] & 1) == 0) {

				Class33 class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[j2];
				class33_2.anInt602 += l4;
				class33_2.anInt603 += i5;
				class33_2.anInt604 += j5;
				class33_2.anInt605++;
				class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[l2];
				class33_2.anInt602 += l4;
				class33_2.anInt603 += i5;
				class33_2.anInt604 += j5;
				class33_2.anInt605++;
				class33_2 = super.aClass33Array1425[i3];
				class33_2.anInt602 += l4;
				class33_2.anInt603 += i5;
				class33_2.anInt604 += j5;
				class33_2.anInt605++;

			} else {

				int l5 = i + (k * l4 + l * i5 + i1 * j5) / (k1 + k1 / 2);
				anIntArray1634[i2] = method481(anIntArray1640[i2], l5,
						anIntArray1637[i2]);

			}
		}

		if (flag) {
			method480(i, k1, k, l, i1);
		} else {

			for (int k2 = 0; k2 < anInt1626; k2++) {

			}

		}

[/quote]Would I replace this? for (int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1630; i2++) { if (anIntArray1640 != null && anIntArray1639 != null) if (anIntArray1640[i2] == 65535 //Most triangles || anIntArray1640[i2] == 0 //Black Triangles 633 Models || anIntArray1640[i2] == 16705 //Nezzy Green Triangles//GWD White Triangles ) anIntArray1639[i2] = 255; int j2 = anIntArray1631[i2]; int l2 = anIntArray1632[i2]; int i3 = anIntArray1633[i2]; int j3 = anIntArray1627[l2] - anIntArray1627[j2]; int k3 = anIntArray1628[l2] - anIntArray1628[j2]; int l3 = anIntArray1629[l2] - anIntArray1629[j2]; int i4 = anIntArray1627[i3] - anIntArray1627[j2]; int j4 = anIntArray1628[i3] - anIntArray1628[j2]; int k4 = anIntArray1629[i3] - anIntArray1629[j2]; int l4 = k3 * k4 - j4 * l3; int i5 = l3 * i4 - k4 * j3; int j5; for (j5 = j3 * j4 - i4 * k3; l4 > 8192 || i5 > 8192 || j5 > 8192 || l4 < -8192 || i5 < -8192 || j5 < -8192; j5 >>= 1) { l4 >>= 1; i5 >>= 1; }
This is what is close under the method[/quote]
